name: Next js API documentation
:LABEL: Curriculum
description: Master the next.js API reference documentation through conversation

name: Next.js CLI Tools Ecosystem
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Identify the two main CLI tools provided by Next.js: create-next-app for project initialization and next for development and build operations;Execute basic CLI commands using the npx command prefix to run tools without global installation;Recognize that running next without a command defaults to next dev for starting the development server;Explain when to use create-next-app versus next CLI commands based on project lifecycle stage
description: Understanding next.js cli tools ecosystem: Identify the two main CLI tools provided by Next.js: create-next-app for project initialization and next for development and build operations

name: Project Initialization with create-next-app
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Execute create-next-app with the latest version tag to initialize new Next.js projects;Navigate through interactive prompts to configure TypeScript, linting, styling, and routing preferences;Choose between recommended defaults, previous settings, or custom configuration based on project requirements;Use the --example flag with official example names or GitHub repository URLs to bootstrap projects from templates;Configure project structure options including src directory usage and custom import aliases during setup;Select appropriate linter during initialization: ESLint for traditional linting with Next.js rules, Biome for combined linting and formatting, or None to configure later
description: Understanding project initialization with create-next-app: Execute create-next-app with the latest version tag to initialize new Next.js projects

name: Development Server Operations
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Start the development server using next dev to enable Hot Module Reloading and error reporting;Configure the development server port using the -p flag or PORT environment variable when the default port 3000 is unavailable;Explain why PORT cannot be set in .env files due to HTTP server initialization occurring before environment file loading;Enable HTTPS for local development using --experimental-https flag when testing webhooks or authentication flows that require secure contexts;Provide custom SSL certificates using --experimental-https-key and --experimental-https-cert flags for specific development scenarios;Recognize that experimental HTTPS with self-signed certificates is only suitable for local development and production requires certificates from trusted authorities
description: Understanding development server operations: Start the development server using next dev to enable Hot Module Reloading and error reporting

name: Production Build Process and Output
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Execute next build to create an optimized production build with route information displayed in the terminal;Interpret build output symbols where circle indicates static prerendered routes and function symbol indicates dynamic server-rendered routes;Explain the performance implications of static versus dynamic rendering based on content update frequency and personalization needs;Use --debug-prerender flag to generate detailed output with stack traces and code frames when diagnosing prerendering errors;Build specific routes using --debug-build-paths with file paths or glob patterns to reduce build time during debugging in large applications;Recognize that debug flags disable server code minification and enable source maps for better error readability but should not be used in production deployments
description: Understanding production build process and output: Execute next build to create an optimized production build with route information displayed in the terminal

name: Production Server Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Start the application in production mode using next start after completing the build process with next build;Configure keep-alive timeouts using --keepAliveTimeout flag with values in milliseconds when deploying behind load balancers or reverse proxies;Set Next.js server timeout values higher than downstream proxy timeouts to prevent premature connection termination and reuse errors;Diagnose connection reuse issues that manifest as proxy errors when timeout configurations are misaligned between Next.js and infrastructure
description: Understanding production server configuration: Start the application in production mode using next start after completing the build process with next build

name: System Diagnostics and Bug Reporting
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Execute next info to collect system information including operating system details, binary versions, and package versions;Interpret the output to identify platform, architecture, available memory, CPU cores, and Node.js version;Include next info output when reporting Next.js bugs in GitHub issues to provide maintainers with environment context;Review package versions displayed for next, react, react-dom, and TypeScript to verify compatibility
description: Understanding system diagnostics and bug reporting: Execute next info to collect system information including operating system details, binary versions, and package versions

name: TypeScript Type Generation
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Generate TypeScript definitions for application routes using next typegen without performing a full build;Combine next typegen with tsc --noEmit in CI workflows to validate route types without building the entire application;Identify that type generation outputs to distDir/types directory, typically .next/dev/types or .next/types;Recognize that next-env.d.ts is generated and included in tsconfig.json to provide Next.js types to the project;Ensure required environment variables are available when running next typegen since it loads Next.js config using the production build phase;Add generated type files to .gitignore to avoid committing build artifacts while keeping next-env.d.ts committed for type availability
description: Understanding typescript type generation: Generate TypeScript definitions for application routes using next typegen without performing a full build

name: Bundle Analysis and Optimization
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Analyze application bundle composition using next experimental-analyze with Turbopack to understand size and content;Explore bundle composition interactively through the local server that starts after analysis completes;Filter bundles by specific routes and switch between client and server views to identify optimization opportunities;Trace the full import chain for modules to understand why specific code is included in bundles;Identify imports across server-to-client component boundaries and dynamic imports that affect code splitting;Write analysis output to disk using --output flag for comparison with future analyses or sharing with team members
description: Understanding bundle analysis and optimization: Analyze application bundle composition using next experimental-analyze with Turbopack to understand size and content

name: Telemetry and Privacy Controls
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Explain that Next.js collects completely anonymous telemetry data about general usage with no personally identifiable information;Use next telemetry commands to check current participation status and opt-out if preferred;Recognize that telemetry participation is optional and helps the Next.js team understand usage patterns for framework improvements
description: Understanding telemetry and privacy controls: Explain that Next.js collects completely anonymous telemetry data about general usage with no personally identifiable information

name: Font Optimization with next/font
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Explain that next/font automatically optimizes fonts by eliminating external network requests and self-hosting font files;Import Google Fonts from next/font/google using the font name as the import specifier with fonts downloaded at build time;Import local fonts from next/font/local with src property pointing to font file paths relative to the loader location;Apply font className to HTML elements to activate the loaded font in the application;Configure font weight as a string for specific weights or omit for variable fonts that support weight ranges;Specify src as an array of objects with path, weight, and style properties when using multiple font files for different weights and styles
description: Understanding font optimization with next/font: Explain that next/font automatically optimizes fonts by eliminating external network requests and self-hosting font files

name: App Router File Conventions
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create page.tsx files to define route UI that is publicly accessible at the corresponding URL path;Implement layout.tsx files to define shared UI that wraps multiple pages and preserves state across navigation;Add loading.tsx files to show loading UI automatically while page content or nested layouts are being fetched;Create error.tsx files to handle errors in route segments and display fallback UI when errors occur;Implement not-found.tsx to customize the 404 page shown when notFound function is called or no route matches;Define API endpoints using route.ts files to handle HTTP requests with standard Web Request and Response APIs
description: Understanding app router file conventions: Create page.tsx files to define route UI that is publicly accessible at the corresponding URL path

name: Client-Side Navigation with next/link
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Import and use the Link component from next/link for client-side navigation between routes;Provide the href prop with pathname strings or URL objects to specify navigation destinations;Recognize that Link components prefetch routes in the viewport by default to improve navigation performance;Replace anchor tags with Link components to enable client-side transitions without full page reloads;Pass additional props like className or target to Link components which forward them to the underlying anchor element
description: Understanding client-side navigation with next/link: Import and use the Link component from next/link for client-side navigation between routes

name: Programmatic Navigation with useRouter
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Import useRouter from next/navigation in Client Components to access navigation methods;Use router.push to navigate to new routes programmatically after user actions or application logic;Use router.replace to navigate without adding a new entry to the browser history stack;Call router.back and router.forward to navigate through browser history;Use router.refresh to refresh the current route and re-fetch data from the server
description: Understanding programmatic navigation with userouter: Import useRouter from next/navigation in Client Components to access navigation methods

name: Route Information Hooks
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Use usePathname hook from next/navigation to read the current URL pathname in Client Components;Use useSearchParams hook to read the current URL query string parameters as a URLSearchParams object;Use useParams hook to read dynamic route parameters from the current route;Recognize that these hooks only work in Client Components and require use client directive;Combine pathname and search params to build conditional UI based on current route state
description: Understanding route information hooks: Use usePathname hook from next/navigation to read the current URL pathname in Client Components

name: Server-Side Navigation Functions
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Call redirect function from next/navigation in Server Components, Route Handlers, or Server Actions to navigate users to different URLs;Call notFound function to render the not-found.tsx file and return a 404 status code;Recognize that redirect and notFound throw errors internally and should be called outside try-catch blocks;Use redirect for navigation after mutations or when access control checks fail in server code;Understand that these functions work in server contexts and cannot be used in Client Components
description: Understanding server-side navigation functions: Call redirect function from next/navigation in Server Components, Route Handlers, or Server Actions to navigate users to different URLs

name: Route Handlers for API Endpoints
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create route.ts files in the app directory to define API endpoints that handle HTTP requests;Export async functions named GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, or OPTIONS to handle corresponding HTTP methods;Receive Web Request objects as the first parameter and return Web Response objects or use NextResponse for enhanced functionality;Access dynamic route parameters through the params object passed as the second parameter to handler functions;Read request data using request.json for JSON bodies, request.formData for form submissions, or request.headers for header values;Set response headers, cookies, and status codes using NextResponse.json with options object
description: Understanding route handlers for api endpoints: Create route.ts files in the app directory to define API endpoints that handle HTTP requests

name: Middleware for Request Interception
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create middleware.ts file in the project root to run code before requests are completed;Export a middleware function that receives NextRequest and returns NextResponse or Response;Use NextResponse.redirect to redirect users to different URLs based on request properties;Use NextResponse.rewrite to serve content from a different URL while keeping the browser URL unchanged;Configure matcher in the exported config object to specify which paths the middleware should run on;Access and modify request headers using request.headers and set response headers using NextResponse.next with headers option
description: Understanding middleware for request interception: Create middleware.ts file in the project root to run code before requests are completed

name: Data Fetching with Extended fetch
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Use the native fetch API in Server Components with Next.js extensions for caching and revalidation;Set cache option to force-cache to cache fetch responses indefinitely or no-store to fetch fresh data on every request;Configure next.revalidate option with number of seconds to revalidate cached data on a time-based schedule;Recognize that fetch requests are automatically memoized during a single render pass to deduplicate identical requests;Understand that fetch caching only applies to GET requests in Route Handlers and is always cached in Server Components by default;Use cache: no-store or revalidate: 0 to opt out of caching for dynamic data that changes frequently
description: Understanding data fetching with extended fetch: Use the native fetch API in Server Components with Next.js extensions for caching and revalidation

name: Route Segment Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Export dynamic config option set to auto, force-dynamic, or force-static to control route rendering behavior;Export revalidate config with number of seconds to set the default revalidation time for a route segment;Export runtime config set to nodejs or edge to specify the runtime environment for the route;Export fetchCache config to override the default fetch caching behavior for all fetch requests in a route;Recognize that segment config options are exported from layout.tsx, page.tsx, or route.ts files;Understand that child segments inherit config from parent segments unless explicitly overridden
description: Understanding route segment configuration: Export dynamic config option set to auto, force-dynamic, or force-static to control route rendering behavior

name: Image Optimization with next/image
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Import and use the Image component from next/image for automatic image optimization;Provide required src and alt props where src is the image path and alt is the accessibility description;Specify image dimensions using width and height props for static images or fill prop for responsive containers;Use priority prop on above-the-fold images to preload them and improve Largest Contentful Paint;Configure loader prop or global loader in next.config.js to customize image optimization service;Apply sizes prop with media query conditions to serve appropriately sized images for different viewport widths
description: Understanding image optimization with next/image: Import and use the Image component from next/image for automatic image optimization

name: Script Loading with next/script
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Import and use the Script component from next/script to optimize loading of third-party scripts;Set strategy prop to afterInteractive to load scripts after page becomes interactive, beforeInteractive for critical scripts, or lazyOnload for low-priority scripts;Use onLoad callback to execute code after the script has finished loading;Recognize that Script components can be placed in any component and Next.js ensures they load only once;Place scripts with beforeInteractive strategy in the root layout to ensure they load before any page code
description: Understanding script loading with next/script: Import and use the Script component from next/script to optimize loading of third-party scripts

name: Metadata API for SEO
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Export a metadata object from layout.tsx or page.tsx to define static metadata like title and description;Export a generateMetadata async function to create dynamic metadata based on route params or external data;Configure title as a string or template object with default and template properties for consistent title patterns;Set description, keywords, authors, and other metadata fields to improve search engine optimization;Define openGraph and twitter metadata objects to control how pages appear when shared on social platforms;Understand that metadata from parent layouts merges with child page metadata with children taking precedence
description: Understanding metadata api for seo: Export a metadata object from layout.tsx or page.tsx to define static metadata like title and description

name: Server and Client Components
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Recognize that components in the app directory are Server Components by default and render on the server;Add use client directive at the top of files to mark components as Client Components that run in the browser;Identify that Server Components can fetch data directly, access backend resources, and keep sensitive information on the server;Understand that Client Components can use React hooks like useState, useEffect, and event handlers for interactivity;Import Client Components into Server Components but not vice versa to maintain proper component boundaries;Pass Server Components as children or props to Client Components to compose server and client rendering
description: Understanding server and client components: Recognize that components in the app directory are Server Components by default and render on the server

name: Streaming and Suspense Boundaries
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Wrap components in Suspense boundaries to stream content and show fallback UI while data loads;Create loading.tsx files that automatically wrap route segments in Suspense boundaries;Understand that streaming sends HTML in chunks allowing users to see content progressively as it becomes ready;Place Suspense boundaries strategically to show important content first while loading secondary content in the background;Use multiple Suspense boundaries to stream different parts of the page independently for better perceived performance
description: Understanding streaming and suspense boundaries: Wrap components in Suspense boundaries to stream content and show fallback UI while data loads

name: Error Handling and Recovery
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create error.tsx files to catch errors in route segments and display fallback UI automatically;Receive error and reset props in error components where error contains error details and reset is a function to retry;Mark error.tsx as Client Components using use client directive since they need interactivity for reset functionality;Create global-error.tsx in the app root to handle errors in the root layout which error.tsx cannot catch;Use error boundaries to isolate errors to specific segments while keeping the rest of the application functional
description: Understanding error handling and recovery: Create error.tsx files to catch errors in route segments and display fallback UI automatically

name: Environment Variables Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Define environment variables in .env.local file for local development with variables loaded automatically;Prefix browser-accessible variables with NEXT_PUBLIC_ to expose them to the client-side code;Access environment variables in server code using process.env.VARIABLE_NAME without any prefix requirement;Recognize that non-prefixed variables are only available in server contexts and never sent to the browser;Create environment-specific files like .env.production and .env.development for different deployment stages;Understand that environment variables are inlined at build time so changing them requires rebuilding the application
description: Understanding environment variables configuration: Define environment variables in .env.local file for local development with variables loaded automatically

name: next.config.js Core Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create next.config.js in the project root to customize Next.js build and runtime behavior;Configure images.domains or images.remotePatterns to allow image optimization for external image sources;Set redirects, rewrites, and headers as async functions that return arrays of configuration objects;Configure experimental features by adding them to the experimental object with appropriate option values;Set output mode to standalone for Docker deployments or export for static HTML export;Use env object to expose environment variables to the browser without NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix for build-time values
description: Understanding next.config.js core configuration: Create next.config.js in the project root to customize Next.js build and runtime behavior

name: Redirects and Rewrites Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Define redirects in next.config.js as an async function returning array of objects with source, destination, and permanent properties;Use path matching patterns with wildcards and parameters in source paths to match multiple URLs;Set permanent to true for 308 redirects or false for 307 redirects based on whether the redirect is permanent;Configure rewrites to serve content from a different URL while keeping the browser URL unchanged;Distinguish between redirects that change the browser URL and rewrites that proxy content transparently;Use basePath in redirect and rewrite paths when the application is deployed under a subpath
description: Understanding redirects and rewrites configuration: Define redirects in next.config.js as an async function returning array of objects with source, destination, and permanent properties

name: Custom Headers Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Define headers in next.config.js as an async function returning array of objects with source and headers properties;Set security headers like Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, and X-Content-Type-Options for all routes or specific paths;Configure CORS headers including Access-Control-Allow-Origin for API routes that need cross-origin access;Use path matching patterns to apply headers to multiple routes with a single configuration;Understand that headers set in next.config.js apply to all matching routes unless overridden in middleware or route handlers
description: Understanding custom headers configuration: Define headers in next.config.js as an async function returning array of objects with source and headers properties

name: Runtime Environment Selection
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Choose nodejs runtime for routes that need full Node.js API access and longer execution times;Choose edge runtime for routes that need global distribution and fast cold starts with limited API access;Set runtime in route segment config or next.config.js to specify the execution environment;Understand that edge runtime has restrictions on Node.js APIs and package compatibility;Recognize that edge runtime is ideal for middleware and simple API routes while nodejs is better for complex server logic
description: Understanding runtime environment selection: Choose nodejs runtime for routes that need full Node.js API access and longer execution times

name: Static Export Configuration
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Set output: export in next.config.js to generate static HTML files for all routes;Recognize that static export does not support features requiring a server like API routes, rewrites, or ISR;Use generateStaticParams in dynamic routes to specify which parameter values to prerender during static export;Understand that static exports can be deployed to any static hosting service without a Node.js server;Configure trailingSlash and images.unoptimized options when using static export for compatibility with hosting providers
description: Understanding static export configuration: Set output: export in next.config.js to generate static HTML files for all routes

name: Hot Module Reloading in Development
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Recognize that Hot Module Reloading automatically updates the browser when code changes are saved without full page refresh;Understand that HMR preserves component state during updates for faster development iteration;Identify that HMR works with both Server Components and Client Components in the App Router;Recognize that HMR is enabled automatically when running next dev with no additional configuration required
description: Understanding hot module reloading in development: Recognize that Hot Module Reloading automatically updates the browser when code changes are saved without full page refresh

name: Turbopack Build Tool
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Enable Turbopack in development using --turbopack flag with next dev for faster build times;Recognize that Turbopack is a next-generation bundler designed to replace Webpack with improved performance;Choose to enable Turbopack during project initialization or add it later to existing projects;Understand that Turbopack provides faster Hot Module Reloading and incremental compilation compared to Webpack
description: Understanding turbopack build tool: Enable Turbopack in development using --turbopack flag with next dev for faster build times

name: Debugging Prerender Errors
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Enable detailed prerender error output using --debug-prerender flag when build fails with prerendering issues;Interpret stack traces and code frames in debug output to identify the exact location of prerender failures;Set experimental.prerenderEarlyExit to false in next.config.js to see all prerender issues in a single build instead of failing on first error;Recognize that prerender errors occur when Server Components throw errors during static generation;Use debug output to identify dynamic API usage in routes marked for static rendering
description: Understanding debugging prerender errors: Enable detailed prerender error output using --debug-prerender flag when build fails with prerendering issues

name: Partial Route Building for Development
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Use --debug-build-paths flag with file paths to build only specific routes during debugging;Provide glob patterns to --debug-build-paths to match and build multiple related routes simultaneously;Recognize that partial builds significantly reduce build time in large applications during development;Understand that partial builds are for debugging only and full builds are required for production deployment
description: Understanding partial route building for development: Use --debug-build-paths flag with file paths to build only specific routes during debugging

name: TypeScript Integration and Type Checking
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Enable TypeScript during project initialization or add it later by creating tsconfig.json;Recognize that Next.js automatically configures TypeScript with optimal settings when tsconfig.json is detected;Use next typegen to generate route types for IDE autocomplete and type checking without full builds;Run tsc --noEmit after next typegen in CI pipelines to validate TypeScript types without building;Understand that Next.js provides built-in TypeScript types for all framework APIs through next-env.d.ts
description: Understanding typescript integration and type checking: Enable TypeScript during project initialization or add it later by creating tsconfig.json

name: ESLint Configuration and Linting
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Enable ESLint during project initialization to get Next.js-specific linting rules from eslint-config-next;Run next lint command to check code for linting errors and warnings;Configure ESLint rules in .eslintrc.json to customize linting behavior for project needs;Recognize that eslint-config-next includes rules for common Next.js issues like missing Image alt text or incorrect Link usage;Add lint script to package.json to integrate linting into development workflow and CI pipelines
description: Understanding eslint configuration and linting: Enable ESLint during project initialization to get Next.js-specific linting rules from eslint-config-next

name: Deployment Output Modes
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Use default output mode for standard deployments with full Next.js server functionality;Set output: standalone in next.config.js to create a minimal server bundle for Docker containers;Recognize that standalone mode copies only necessary files reducing deployment size and improving container build times;Configure output: export for static HTML generation when server features are not needed;Understand that output mode affects which Next.js features are available in the deployed application
description: Understanding deployment output modes: Use default output mode for standard deployments with full Next.js server functionality

name: Request and Response Objects in Route Handlers
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Access request body using await request.json for JSON payloads or await request.formData for form submissions;Read request headers using request.headers.get method with header name as parameter;Extract URL search parameters using new URL with request.url and accessing searchParams property;Return JSON responses using NextResponse.json with data object and optional status code;Set response cookies using NextResponse.json with cookies option or response.cookies.set method;Add custom headers to responses using headers option in NextResponse.json or response.headers.set method
description: Understanding request and response objects in route handlers: Access request body using await request.json for JSON payloads or await request.formData for form submissions

name: Dynamic Route Parameters
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create dynamic route segments using square bracket notation in folder names like [id] or [slug];Access dynamic parameters in page components through params prop passed automatically by Next.js;Access dynamic parameters in route handlers through params object passed as second argument to handler functions;Use catch-all routes with [...slug] notation to match multiple path segments;Implement optional catch-all routes with [[...slug]] notation that also match the parent path;Generate static paths for dynamic routes using generateStaticParams function for static site generation
description: Understanding dynamic route parameters: Create dynamic route segments using square bracket notation in folder names like [id] or [slug]

name: Parallel and Intercepting Routes
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create parallel routes using @folder notation to render multiple pages in the same layout simultaneously;Access parallel route content through props named after the slot in the parent layout component;Implement intercepting routes using (..) notation to show routes in modals or overlays while preserving URL;Combine parallel and intercepting routes to create modal flows that work with browser navigation;Understand that parallel routes enable showing different content in different parts of the layout based on the current route
description: Understanding parallel and intercepting routes: Create parallel routes using @folder notation to render multiple pages in the same layout simultaneously

name: Route Groups and Organization
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Create route groups using parentheses notation like (marketing) to organize routes without affecting URL structure;Use route groups to apply different layouts to different sections of the application;Recognize that route group names do not appear in the URL path;Organize related routes into groups for better code organization and shared layouts;Create multiple root layouts by using route groups to segment the application into distinct sections
description: Understanding route groups and organization: Create route groups using parentheses notation like (marketing) to organize routes without affecting URL structure

name: Server Actions for Mutations
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Define Server Actions by adding use server directive at the top of async functions;Call Server Actions from Client Components to perform server-side mutations without API routes;Access form data in Server Actions using FormData parameter when called from form submissions;Return data from Server Actions to update UI after mutations complete;Use Server Actions with useFormStatus hook to show pending states during form submissions;Understand that Server Actions automatically handle serialization and can be called directly from event handlers
description: Understanding server actions for mutations: Define Server Actions by adding use server directive at the top of async functions

name: Caching and Revalidation Strategies
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Distinguish between full route cache for static routes and data cache for fetch requests;Use revalidatePath function to purge cache for specific paths after data mutations;Use revalidateTag function to purge cache for all fetch requests with a specific cache tag;Configure time-based revalidation using revalidate option in fetch or route segment config;Understand that on-demand revalidation with revalidatePath or revalidateTag provides immediate cache updates;Recognize that caching behavior differs between development and production with more aggressive caching in production
description: Understanding caching and revalidation strategies: Distinguish between full route cache for static routes and data cache for fetch requests

name: Internationalization and Localization
:LABEL: Concept
understanding_criteria: Configure locales and default locale in next.config.js for internationalized routing;Create locale-specific routes using [lang] dynamic segments to handle different languages;Use Accept-Language header or cookies to detect user language preference;Implement language switchers using Link components with locale-specific hrefs;Organize translations using JSON files or internationalization libraries;Set lang attribute on html element based on current locale for accessibility and SEO
description: Understanding internationalization and localization: Configure locales and default locale in next.config.js for internationalized routing
